text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Arms, Gustav Torg, Malmö - (wow Top 50 Foreign Stout, nice find) pours black with a creamy tan head. Roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste, nice decadent notes of chocolate and caramel, rich and sweet, some charred burnt malty accents in the finish, top stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Kolsvart med tunt rödbeige skum. Doftar kafferosteri, choklad och lite bränd karamell. Smaken fyllig och ganska besk med ordentligt brända kaffetoner, choklad och lite maltsötma. Lång eftersmak, syrlig och besk med mest kaffe, choklad och lite lakrits. Lugnt kolsyrad. Bf.datum 1704.

7%. Ser fullständigt massiv ut vid upphällning. Skulle förmodligen får hela OPEC-kartellen att trilla ur sarongerna av nervositet. Mycket choklad och bränd malt i aromen. Trots ett utseende som skriker av viskositet är känslan ganska snäll. Smaken är syra, bäska och bränd malt. Såg inledningsvis "riktigt jävlig ut" och övergick i en positiv överraskning...det brukar vara tvärtom.

A small 250 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with almost no head. Coffee, licorice, vanilla. Roast malt, surprisingly light with a smooth palate and a long coffee finish. Did not inspire that much.

Bottle from IP trade with Nisse666, many thanks, man.Very dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, light smoke. Taste, Strong coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, vanilla, salt. Powefull, tasty stout.

Svart och ganska lätt. Rostade smaker med lite kallt kaffe. Lite för snäll för att verkligen lyfta.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black color. Roasted aromas of malt and coffee, smoke. Roasted taste, chocolate, coffee, smoke. Bitter, roasted finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours thick black with creamy, lightly tanned head. Lightly smoked aroma with tobacco, soy, liquourice and chocolate. Strong liquorice flavor with some light caramel, brown sugar and chocolate. Silky mouthfeel with light carbonation and a lightly bitter, salty liquourice finish.
25 cl systembolaget. Blev inte alls nöjd med denna. En klar besvikelse men all Stout kan inte smaka bra.

Stout prosto ze Szwecji ma ciemnobrązowy kolor i niewielką, beżową pianę. Zapach bardzo przyjemny - czekolada, dużo czekolady, paloność i kawa. W smaku także czekolada na pierwszym planie. Oprócz niej palone słody i nuty kawy. Piwo jest oleiste, aksamitne. Fajna goryczka, alkohol dobrze przykryty, lekko rozgrzewa. Bardzo dobre, solidne piwo!

Black in color with a nice looking dense head. Aroma is dominated by tobaccoo, soy, coffee, also some chocolate notes, some kind of wet wood, but not like a barrel, more woodsy if that makes sense. Flavour has that ashy tobaccoo as well, bitter chocolate and a herbal thing going on. Quite easy drinking with a slick texture and gentle carbonation.

250ml bottle from Systembolaget. Pitch black with a small tanned head, good lacing. Roasted aroma with smoky notes, roasted coffee beans, cocoa and ashes. Silky mouthfeel, gently carbonated. The taste has roasted and woody notes, dark chocolate, coffee and licorice.

Really dark tones of chocolate, coffe, browned sugar and some dried fruits. Poors noce and dark with a foam that dissapears quickly. Taste takes the same as in the nose, and finnishes of with some hoppy grass flavours. Its a really good stout.

Flaska från SB. Svart vätska med tunnt brunt skum som dröjer sig kvar, lämnar en del rester på glaset. Sötsura, rostade toner av kaffe, choklad, soja, svamp, kola, toffee och en del torkad frukt. Halvtunn kropp, krämig, runda och oljig. Runda och lena kaffetoner i smaken som samsas med kola, choklad och en välbalanserad beska.
250 ml bottle. Pours black with short tan head. Aromas of molasses, oily black coffee, and roasted malts. Flavors of black coffee, liquorice and dry roasted barley. Oily. Nice
Bottle. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, licorice, chocolate, light fruity, some smoked notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Look; fruity beige layer on the black body with rosewood edge.
Aroma; black malts, prunes, roasted coffee from the chimney, steam bun, dark fruits, berry peels.
Taste; fresh plack plums, liquorice the fruity way, coffee, black chocolate, some dark cocoa, nut sauce as well.
Slightly dry n good body with soft carbonation.
Flourish finish with black chocolate. Nice dark sipper.
[25cl br btl abv7% [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */]

Bottle @ home. cellar aged for 3 years. Black liquid with a really a creamy, lasting dark beige head, nice! Slightly vinous, slightly sweet aroma. Its roasted with dates, raisins, dark chocolate, cocoa, dark bread. Medium bodied and somewhat sweet taste. Roasted notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, honey, dates, coffee, raisins. Lasting balanced bitterness.

Backlog, 2013 bottle. Deep brown, tan head, quickly dissipating leaving no lacings. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, burnt leather, slight chocolate. Taste is slight rough, bitter, roasted, malt and coffee, minor sweet notes with berries, bitterness and dry coffee in the finish. Medium body, low carbo. Solid.
Nice mouthfeel when drinking, goes nice with a fastlagsbulle or "lentbun". Overall a really nice stout. Not too thin, a common trait in stouts. Served in 250ml bottle from systembolaget.

(Nynäshamns Sotholmen Extra Stout) Bottle 250 ml at home, from a trade with hackobock as an extra, thanks Jakob! Served into a snifter, ABV 7%
Thick pour, resulting in a totally black beer, with two fingers of dark brown head sitting on top. Great retention, heavy lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of roasted malts, light coffee, liquorice.
Taste also of roasted malts and coffee, light metallic notes, coal.
Full body, carbonation is just right, smooth and creamy on the palate.
Very good.
How: Bottle Appearance: Black, minimal tan head. Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, raisins, nuts, mild smoke. Palate: Medium body, soft carbonation.
Black color, light brown head. Chocolate nose, cured meat, roasted malt, hint of smoke. Chocolate taste, coffee, roasted malt, hint of licorice, dry finish. Full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from SB 141226. 7.0%
Black body with a rather rapidly vanishing dark tan head. heavy roasted malt with some tar in the nose. Rather pale palate with only hints of coffee and chocolate. A nice porter more than a stout. Had expected more with that alc strenght. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@ Nedre Mölla 11/12-14. Aroma: Smokiness, smoked charkuteries, roasted malt, notes of coffee. Taste: Roasted malt, coffee. Body is medium, the finish is dry and roasted with notes of coffee.

250ml brown bottle 2014 years vintage rated 7.0% ABV, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is opaque brownish black with a medium sized brown thick creamy head with good retention, that when reduced left lacing behind. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, liquorice, vanilla. Flavours of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and liquorice. Taste is medium-light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium-full bodied, creamy texture and average carbonation. A nice looking and delicious and roasty Stout.
Flaska från SB. Svart med beige skum. Doft av tjära och choklad. Syrlig med inslag av tjära.

Pours Jetblack as expected, very heavy smoked aroma, the taste follows the same trait. Very smokey stout, almost a tad to heavy on that note, possibly drowning out other elements. Some chocolate and coffe but not as much as i expected. Still a very nice stout, if smokey traits is something you are after this one fits the bill.
Bottle from SB.

250 ml bottle. Clear dark brown with tanned head. Smell is sweet malty with roasted tones, coffee, chocolate and liqurice. Taste is sweet malty with roasted tones, cold coffee and chocolate. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

0,25l bottle. Pitch black with minimal head.
Mild aroma of liquorice, milk chocolate and cold coffee.
In taste there is more cold coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and hint of smoke.
Medium bitterness, medium to light body, almost watery.
Softly bitter finish with cold coffee and sugar.
Light and mediocre stout.

Bottle. Thick black body with a creamy brown head. Massive aroma of roasted malt, grains, spices. Taste of roast, dark chocolate, raisins, burned pepper. Mild vanilla notes. Dry roasted finish with ash and spice. A real pleasure. What I like about this beer is that it looks, smells and taste like a notably stronger stout, yet its only 6,6.

Nice coffe aroma, a little bit of milk chocolate. Dry taste, bitter taste of coffe and a sweet taste of chocolate. Medium body. Soft carbonation. A slice to much bitterness in this beer to be a great beer.

Draught. Pitch black with a dense, tanned head. Roasted aroma with yeasts, earthy hops, fruits, dark, dried fruits, coffee, some smoke. Taste is roasted bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted with chocolate, coffee, some yeasts and fruits. Indeed a nice Stout.

Bottle. 7.0%. Best before 04.15. Pours black with a dark tan head. Almost no lacing. Sweetish and roasted aroma, with a hint of barbecue. Hints of wood and salt as it warms. Flavour is roasted and a bit smoked. Light wood as it warms, as well as a remote cardboard overtone. Bitter roasted finish with a lingering tart note. A bit too much carbonation. Overall pretty good, well-balanced, but lacks some complexity. 21.05.14.

Flaska. Svart md moccafärgat skum. Doftar soja, bitter choklad, stall, sur frukt. Rökigheten dominerar i smaken, men där hittas också kaffe, mörk choklad, rostad malt och en rejäl sälta. En njutbar stout.

BOTTLE 25CL from rosenbergh. Thanks, Jan!

Look: pitch black with a big and dense espresso head.
Aroma: rich chocolate, coffee, a tad salty/savoury and juct a touch of smoked sausage.
Taste: roasted acidity, coffee, light chocolate sweetness, solid hop bitterness and ashes in the finish.
Great beer. With only 6,7 abv it is one foot into the imperial territory.

black colour with a dark creamy head. Aroma of roasted malt with coffee and dark chocolate. Also some dried red berries, dates and a slight note of liquorice. Taste of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt and a light taste of berries with some sourness.

Tap at the Bishops Arms (Gustav Adolfs Torg) Malmo. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy light tan head with plenty of broken lace. The aroma is creamy roasted malt with a slightly resin sourness which reduced with time. The flavour is medium sour light bitter with a dry malt resin light liqourice palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Not so bad but I think it would be a whole lot better if they sold more of this beer. It seemed a little stale. I was probably the only person that ordered this beer all night long.

25cl bottle via winter Secret Santa 2013/2014. Pours an oily black with some interesting, cloudy white head. Nose has a lot of soy, raisin, molasses, brown sugar, toast, bread crust, yeast. Flavor is malty, bread, soy, molasses, pencil lead, a little ribber, brown sugar. Full bodied, oily finish. Solid.

Bottle, 01/02/14, ABV 6.7%. Pours dark brown, almost black with a decent-sized, quickly dissipating, mocha-colored head. Aroma is quite a lot of cocoa and light dark fruit. Roast comes through more powerful later on. Taste is a lot of roasted coffee, medium cocoa. Cocoa on the finish. Roasted malts, even ashiness on the aftertaste. Surprisingly light, should be fuller. Good carbonation. Doesnt really handle spicy Mexican food that well, though usually dunkels, porters and stouts do.

Opaque black colour with delicate small head. Strong dark chocolate, vanilla and coffee aromas. Really, really good aroma! Taste has lots of coffee, some sweet dark chocolate and some grassy hop flavors. Taste isnt on par with the brilliant aroma. Medium-to-rich body and quite high carbonation. Pretty good stout.

A 6.6% stout? Well, that certainly didnt prepare me for such a rich black body and incredibly stable, very dark coffee tan head. Aroma of almonds, coffee, bit roasted. Smooth toasty and dark malts. (33cl bottle brought by Bertanne from Uppsala, thanks!)

Bottle 2013: nice surprise.  
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Doftar kaffe, lite choklad och sötlimpa. Krämig munkänsla, men lite vattnig smak, rostad malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,25l bottle from the flagship Alko. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee and hops. Quite decent.

Aroma has smoke, roasted malt, coffee.
Flavor is sweet, roasted, smoky.
Fullbodied and warming stout.

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (25:-). Rökta charkuterier i både doft och smak. Ganska torr och söt avslutning med kaffetoner. Tycker den påminner en hel del om Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier, men i en light-version.

Bottle 25 cl from Systembolaget. Black with a thin dark brown head. Smoke, smoked meat, roasted malt, licorice?, burnt wood. Full body, very thick and creamy, low carbonation, bitter finish. Very nice!
Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is rye bread, honey, chocolate, muscovado sugar. Taste is rye bread, honey, muscovado sugar. Very nondescript and bland unfortunately.

250 ml bottle. Pours dark with almost no head. Flavor and aroma is full of roasted malts, coffee and licorice. Nice dryness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

250ml bottle from Alko Arkadia
BBE 12/2014 - Pours pitch black with a tiny head. Aroma of roasted malts, hints of sweet milk chocolate, wood and cocoa. Taste is sweet, slightly roasty and milky with hints of chocolate, coffee and licorice. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and chocolatey. Okay, quite balanced stout.

250 ml bottle. Black, with a thin brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and notes of coffee. The flavour is roasted malty, with chocolate and coffee, and a roasted hoppy finish with smoky and asky notes. Excellent stout, very tasty.
Black with nice soft creama. Aroma roasted and smoked notes. Taste bittersweet, roasted and smoked, licorice. Medium body, text smooth, finish bittersweet, smoked

Nice smoky, charcutery aroma with some ryebread, wet wood (sauna) and coffee. 
Pitch black with thick beige head 
Faint malt sweetness in the beginning, smoke and charceturies in the interlude finished of with a really nice round bitterness 
Full body, creamy with low carbonation 
This really is a fantastic stout. A pity the bottle is so small, I want more
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Kolsvart tjock med medium stort ljusbrunt skum! Rökig och lite söt i doft! Smakar rökmalt lite kaffe och vanilj!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours black with a small dense brown head. Aroma has burnt malts, licorice, coffee. Taste is light sweet and light bitter chocolate up front. Finish is bitter chocolate and roasted malts, light/medium body.
Bottle 25 cl @ west hervanta. Pours black with medium beige head. Dark malts, coffee. Cocoa, dark malts in the flavour. Very balanced.
Flaska 2007. Lite av en raritet. Hittar inget kaffe ellet rostat i doften, vilket kändes lite otippat. Lite honung möjligen. Krämig och fin.

How: Draught.
Where: SBWF 2013.
Appearance: Black colour with a brown head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Roasted malt, caramel, coffee, fruit.
Bottle. Ruby brown color with a minimal brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, peat and roasted malt. Roasty taste with some bitterness. Slightly oily feel.
Bottle from Alko. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, roasted malts, liquorice, nuts and vanilla. Bitter finish with coffee and liquorice. Very nice stout.
Bottle from arkadia alko, helsinki. Black color, nice brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, licorice, coffee. Taste is medium body, licorice, coffee, some hops at the end.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 23.08.2013, 0,25l bottle @ home:
Small creamy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, dark malts, dark sugar, butterscotch, licorice, chocolate, caramel, grass, almond cake, coffee. Taste is kind of watery and oxidiced, dark malts, butterscotch, grass, licorice, sour coffee, dark sugar. Longlasting bitterness. Boring.

25cl bottle from Alko. BB 12/14. Pitch black, brown thin head. Oatmeal sweetness, roasted malty aroma, tempting. Flavor has strong coffee, licorice, roastedness. Full bodied, long dry finish with coffee lingering. Really good.

Dark black with a creamy brown head. 
Nose: Vanilla, dark chocolate, pumpernickel, soy sauce and fudge. 
A great, creamy, full body. 
Taste of chocolate, tobacco, dark bread, grapefruit cest, licorice and caramel. 
A long lasting bitterness. 
Great!

Pours engine oil black with a good tan head, it thins quickly. Roasted aromas, perhaps burned woodland with coffee vanilla essence.  In the mouth a bubbly carbonated sensation, thin with minimal afterglow. What you would expect from a 7% 'stout' . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4 finger brown head that sank to 6 mm, black body. Nose: Smoked notes, charcuterie and milk-chocolate. Aroma: Coffee, dark chocolate, figs, raisins, dates, milk-chocolate, ash and smoked notes. Semi-long dry ending, some bitterness.
Almost black with small head. Tar, chocolate and hints of vanilla in the aroma. Also in the taste, combined with citrus and distinct bitterness.
Krämig, med smak av tjära och rök, dessvärre förstör den tydliga beskan helhetsupplevelsen.

Bottle thanks to SaintMatty. It pours near black with a small tan head. The nose is roasty, coffee, soy sauce, toasted sesame, chocolate and a touch of mint. The taste is earth, roasted malt, pleasant bitterness, coffee grinds, ash, light soy sauce and green pepper with a dry, roasty finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Decent foreign stout, but not overly drinkable.

250ml bottle, 2012 edition. Darkbrown, almost black, with a warm whitebrown creamy head. Roasted malt, pumpernickel, filter coffee, dark syrup, soy. Nice touch of bitter orange in the aftertaste, along with a nice alcohol warmth.

Black beer, beautiful dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts. Taste is surprisingly tasteless, just a soft creamy mouthfeel. I guess the taste the same as the aroma. Soft roasted finish that could be stronger. A bit of chocolate in there somewhere.
Dark, almost black. Has an off-white head, medium duration. Dark aroma too, roasted malts, faint chocolate. Flavor starts sweet, chocolate, milk, port, cocoa. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.

25 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 15.09.2010
Aroma has roasted notes, some licorice and coffee. Flavour has somewhat salty licorice, soy sauce and some coffee. Good, but I expected more.
Good taste and smell. A little metallic taste, maybe a bit thin in flavor. The aftertaste is left long. Good beer but would still not recomend this beer.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours black with a brown head.
Smoke, hemp rope, sweet and roasted malt and coffee hits the nose.
Taste has loads of heavily roasted malt, some smoke, dry cocoa powder, and some small liquorice and dark fruit notes. Dry, ashy finish with some alcohol.
Quite thick mouth feeling, medium carbonation.
250 ml bottle. Pours midnight black with a mocca-colored lasting head. Aroma of smoke and coffee. Tastes a bit tangy (especially with increasing temp), tar, smoke and liquorice. Nice soft bitterness.
light smoked aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, fizzy, soft nice smoked finish.

Svart öl med litet mörk brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe, syrlig jäst doft, blommor, kakao, rom russin. Smak: Torkad frukt, sot, kaffe, kakao, choklad doppad skumbanan, mineraler. Mycket fin eftersmak av hård kaffekaramell och choklad doppad skumbanan.
Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter nice coffee flavor. Long nice finish. Oily palate.
Bottled. Pours black with a huge brown head. Smell smoky roasted malt. Tastes fresh smoky roasted malt, alot of peat with a similar finish.

Bottle 7%. Black, tan head. Nose has creamy chocolate, some coffee. Mocha. Body is soft, full. Surprisingly dry. Malts, a tad of hops. Roasted tones in the finish. Nice, almost cramy, mouthfeel, but the dryness is a bit annoying.-- bb/h

Det här är absolut inte någon dålig öl men jag kan inte låta bli att känna mig lite besviken. Snaken är lite torr och spretig med inslag av kaffe, fruktig syra och kryddor, dessutom är kroppen lite för tam.

Pours black with fairly low tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and smoke. Taste is sweetish with thick, smoky bitterness in the finish. Body is fairly light but creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice little bottle, much better than a regular stout but still not as imposing aS an imperial. Of course black no surprise there. Will have again.
On tap at Haandfestival 2012. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is mocha, chocolate, dried fruits. Flavour is malt, hop, coffee, mocha, chocolate, dried fruits. Full bodied nice beer.

On tap at HaandFestival 2012. A dense, tan to dark beige head sits on top of a more or less black body. Mocha, chocolate, some dried fruits and a nice dosage of caramel in the aroma. Surprisingly, some alcohol too. The flavor has some bitterness to keep the caramel and chocolate company, and theres also a touch of dried fruits. Its full-bodied, sweetish and slightly warming on the palate. Coffee- and hop-bitter finish. Well, its tasteful and mellow, I like it very well, still I feel somethings missing. 120504
Black with an off white head - nice aroma of roasted malts - nice malt body that has some roasted malt notes, olso with some chocolate and olso some bitterness from roasted malt - htis was very good
Aroma is very heavy and complex.Tar, soy sauce, chocolate, dark syrup. Medium heavy flavour. Sweet malt, smoke. Not a typical heavy "only-three-sips-stout". (Tegnérs gömställe, 30.07.2010)
Dark brown with a small beige head. Malty and roasted tones. Malt, fruit, coffee and raosted. Full body with a nice balanced finish.

Sampled @ HaandBryggeriet Beer festival 2012. Black body with a small beige head. Aroma of dark roasted malt, coffee and alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malty, roast, coffee, chocolate and fine bitterness. Full body and good aftertaste. A nice one.

@ Haand festival.
Pour black, with a small tan head. 
Aroma of coffee, slight chocolate, and a little bit of licorice.
Taste is sweet upfront, with a long and bitter aftertaste. 
Average body, with a flat carb.
On tap @Haand2012. Pours black with a beige. Aroma of roasted malt , chocolate, grains and malt. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some chocolate and grains. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malt, coffee, nuts. Taste is malt, coffee, notes of dark chocolate, wood, nuts. Medium body, soft cabonation. 180412
Smells dry, taste is chocolate and bitter. Rich malt in there. Very nice beer, not terribly complex but a nice dry stout.

Bottle @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Black pour, solid tan head. Aroma is roasty, somewhat bready, chocolate and nuts. Flavor is creamy roasted bready malts with a nice subtle bitterness, somewhat sweet chocolate and a huge body. Very well balanced and drinkable brew.
Bottle. Black with big brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, liquorice and a little smoke. Flavour is roasted malts, strong liquorice, medium sweet, chocolate and a little smoke.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Nice creamy tan head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich english licorice, roast malt, a little smoke, notes of coffee and hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. Quite smooth and long finish.
A powerful stout with lots of chocolate and coffee bitterness. Rather rough and somewhat unpolished feeling gives this beer a sting above the usual.

On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a dark brown with small beige head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is a roasted malt and smoke. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet roasted malt and smoke finish. A good Foreign stout.
Pour is a thick black with a sticky tan head. Smell is a tart citrus chocolate. Taste is dry Roasty chocolatey great mouthfeel. Coffee and raisons.

1/21/12. On tap. Black pour with a nice brown head. Nice aroma with toasted marshmallow, dark chocolate, and a bit of roast. Slightly sweet entry with roasted coffee, something a bit medicinal, tobacco, and leather. Very interesting.

Thanks GT2! Deep brown pour with a sudsy off white head. Lactic sugar, roasted barley, earthen farm (think 2 year old manure), cocoa nib, and coffee with a syrupy dark fruit finish. Medium to full body with a dry roasty finish.

Bottle: thanks to VsXsV:
Wow, pours an almost pitch black beer! Only in the pour itself, in the thinnest part of pouring, there comes some ruby tints through. Ok a pitch black beer (with some ruby tints on the edges) with a thick and vast smaller brown head. Looks good!
Smell bread, dried flowers, coffee/espresso, glue, card board, hint of deep roasted malts. Strange...
Taste is a good mix of meat, smoked meat, smoke, roasted/smoked/burned malts and barleys, good bitter, hint of coffee and dark chocolate. (well done, less to no liquorice).
Incredible taste!
Good bitter roasted and some herbs in the aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft silky mouthfeel with a slight hint of something tingly, a full body and a creamy oily texture.
Smell is a bit strange but the appearance and taste are outstanding. Good brew!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottled 25cl. Courtesy of jonas. Strong tar components. Good bitterness. Very trhue to the style. Dry finish. Thanks a lot jonas!

Bottle from Systembolaget, Nordstan, Gøteborg.Pours black as coal with a big frothy strong tanned head. Aroma of smoked meat and bacon. Taste is strong roasted and light smoked malts with a nice bitter liquorice note towards the end. A strong and well tasting Swede.
Bottle, pours black with khaki head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolat and coffee. Taste is like aroma, with medium bitterness. Light-Medium mouthfeel. OK
Pours black with medium thick head. Aromas of tar, liqourise, oak and coffee. Body is quite creamy but ends watery. An ok bitterness. Tastes of coffe, tar and oak. A good Swedish Stout.

Bottle at 3 Små Rum. 2006 edition. Pours pitch black with a dense tan head. The aroma is hard roasted malt, ligth chocolate, liquorice and light coffee. Bitter malty flavour with notes of roast, hops, chocolate, liquorice and coffee.

0.25L bottle, purchased @Systembolaget Norstan.  A layer of small  choco-brown bubbles, covering a jet black body. Modest aroma of slight ashy dark malts, salty licorice and a coffee-like scent. Taste is more prononced. Clean dark malts. Dry/sweet, rounded and light ashy. A balancing bitterness blend well in. Suggestions of dark dried fruits and tar. More than medium full. Nice creamy texture. Complex malty-roasted-bitter finish. A really nice Stout.

Bottle and ABV says 7%. Pours a black color with a tan head. Aroma is of roasted malt, ashy notes, light smoke, dark fruits like prunes and raisins along with subtle coffee and chocolate. The flavor is again of the subtle chocolate and coffee, with roasted malt, light smoke and lots of dark fruit with flavors of raisin and prune. The body is medium with a smooth mouthfeel. Overall a pretty tasty Foreign Stout.

Lovely black, oily viscosity. Dark foam and nice lacing. A bit tart aroma with hints of liquorice/ ammonium chloride, a tar smokiness, and julmust (Swedish root beer style soda for Christmas). Powerful on the palate. First some fruit then tar pastille, raw liquorice (root), and coffee. A well balanced bitterness emerge from below which gives the dry finish a nice timbre. A really heavy stout both in taste and character. A bit thin body though.
2011-11-02

25 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Black, opaque liquid with medium to big, tan head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, fruit and roasted malt. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and quite roasty. A bit fruity. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Creamy, oily mouthfeel. Nice one, though a bit rough.

250 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours oily black with a big chocolate brown head that quickly dissipates. Smell is dominated by heavily roasted malts, oatmeal and chocolate. Smell is sweet with heavily roasted (almost burnt) malts, wood, hazelnuts and coffee. Its quite bitter and finishes off bitter with lots of coffee.

Enriktigt mörk öl med medelfylligt ljusbrunt skum. En doft av lätt rökighet, aska och rostat kaffe. Smak av rostad malt, kaffe, lakrits och choklad. En torr och trevlig beska i eftersmaken, vilken dröjer sig kvar riktigt länge.

Bottle 25cl from Mondial de la bière, 7° on my bottle. A dark, viscous and thick with low head. Nose is very roasted, a bit smoked like. Aroma is very roasted, sweet, licorice like, intense coffee notes with a vinous presence. Dry grapes notes and leather presence, finish is sweet and tobacco like with a hints of vanilla, very drinkable.

Bottle 50cl (Thanks a lot Omhper). A clear black colour with a high beige head. An aroma of roasted almost burned malt, coffee and smoke. The taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long light bitter finish.

Jag som inte är någon rökölsfantast tyckte att denna var lite för bränd/rökig. Annars en ganska lätt stout (åtminstone för att vara extra) med drag av lakritskola och hårdrostat kaffe. Rund och mjuk vilket gjorde att de lite vassare smakerna tonades ner och hölls ihop.

Bottle @ Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm, July 29 2011. Bottle said 7% ABV. Small brown head on top of a pitch black opaque beer. Smell dark chocolate, burned malts and coffee. Smooth texture, soft carbo, very nice taste.
Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted bitter finish. Smooth. 060711

Soft, smoky aroma of roasted malt, coffee and some shades of chocolate. Mmmm very nice! Great rounded taste of roasted malt and coffee with hop aromas and notes of chocolate. Good dry bitterness in the aftertaste. A very good and nice beer!

Bottle (Dank an joss!) Pitch black, as usual, stable and lacy small tanned head; moderate leathery and ashy nose with a mineralic touch; moderate tosolid dry bitter-sweet flavour, relatively light bodied; a tinge of brandy in the lingering fruity and roasty finish. Good, no doubt.....

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2011 Bottle. 
Black with a light brown head. 
Aroma: roasted, some spiciness. 
Taste: roasted malt, rubber, wine gums, coffee, licorice, some spiciness, medium bitter. 
Medium-bodied. 
Better than last time on draught.

Tap@Ölrepubliken. Pours deep dark brown with a tense creamy briwn head leaving nice lace. Aroma is tary, smokey, a bit sweet, hoppy and fruity. Velvety acidy fullbodied mouthfeel. Flavor is acidy, smokey, tary, fruity, perry, roasted malty and bitter. Nice lean palate. Finishes fruity, tary and bitter tart.

(bottle, 25cl, 7.0% ABV; courtesy of Jonas) Black colour with a beige-brown short foamy head. Slightly sweet and leathery roast-malty aroma with earthy notes, coffee and hints of vanilla. Roast-bittter flavour, medium bodied at most with a soft carbonation. Roast-malty, earthy and leathery taste with traces of coffee and salt; roasty bitter and slightly salty finish with notes of coffee in the aftertaste. Likeable Stout. 11.V.11

Bottle. Licorice and dark chocolate aroma
Opaque black, low brown ring
Tobacco roast, Scandinavian licorice 
Light sparkly mouthfeel, oily smooth finish. Dry licorice aftertaste.
Tap at Man in the Moon.  Dark brown, large tan head.  Aroma of cocoa powder and coffee grounds.  Taste is coffee and chocolate.  Decent.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2012 Tap at Man in the Moon in Stockholm, Sweden. Poured a deep cola red with a nice tan head. Sheety lace remains. Aroma is burnt cherries, sweet abbey dubbel notes like chocolate, spicy yeast, must, cherries. Taste is bitter, floral, lemon, chalky yeast, burnt cherry, sweet syrup, roast. Palate is astringent but still creamy. Would do well as Abbey Dubbel actually versus Foreign Stout. 250mL thanks to anders37. Deeper sepia pour. Red, thick head. Nose is quite lactic like a milk stout with coffee cake, frosting, soy, sweet run soaked cherries, fermenting fruit cake. Taste is metallic, fairly watery, with gritty bitterness. Decent. Like a foreign stout.

250 ml bottle in Germany. Thanks much to omhper. Is a dark black color. Brown dense head. Roast, smoke, chocolate and some coffee in the aroma. Flavor of tart, sweetness, roast, chocolate and smoke. Some sweetness notable. Is full bodied with some oil with it. Quite dry. The main draw back is is has a coffee metal bitterness end.

250ml bottle, 7,0% ABV. Pours almost pitch black, a slight brownish tinge at the edge, and a thick brown head. Very malty nose, heavy roast, loads of dark chocolate, ground coffee, hints of wood (even though this beers never been anywhere near a wooden barrel), Finnish memma, soy. Off-dry, full bodied, creamy, balanced bitterness. Very rich, very malty, heavy roast, chocolate, coffee beans, vanilla (?), faintly spicy/hoppy. Long, roasted, fruity finish, although lacks a little bit in complexity. (2010-12-12)

You have to love when you take the bartenders suggestion and two locals comment how good it is. Bottle into a snifter. Pours black a medium tan head, really nice and flavorful in both aroma and taste. This is a perfect stout inbetween a us stout and English stout, almost a stout sessional. Easy to drink, semi light feel but tons of flavor.

Bottle, 33cl - Opaque dark brown beer with a large brown head. Aroma is malty with vinuous notes of raisin, leather and chocolate. Flavor is malty with smokey notes of toast, soy sauce and licorice. Truely great beer.

250ml Bottle (Tack Gert and Eva :) ) - Black with a tan head. Rich aroma with notes of plain chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Roasted, malty and chocolatey taste with a slight sweetness and hints of coffee.

Thanks to the kind soul who shared this at the So Long Sea Bass Tasting.  Pours stout black with a tan head.  Nose is roast, campfire, smoke, bandaid, and ash.  Flavor is similar with smokiness all over and some light roast and chocolate coming through.  Finish lingers with chocolate, ash , and campfire.

Thanks to anders37 for this beer

It pours black with a tan head which quickly disappears. The flavor has some soy, bittersweet chocolate and a touch of anise. Its very easy drinking.

0,25 l bottle, thanks Ompher!.
Poured black as night, small but stable, foamy and creamy brown head. Peated-smoked aroma with burnt woods, roasted grains, tobacco and dark chocolate, some molasses and caramel. Deep roasted flavor, wood and peat, dark chocolate, espresso coffee, caramel and lurking herbal hops. Wow!
Black with a solid, lacing brown fluffy head.  Chocolatey, coffee-roasty aroma.  Coca and roasty flavor.  A solid stout.
Nice one. Very appealing to the eye. Smells sweet. Sweetness from honey? Full body.

(25cl bottle) Courtesy of Joss. Thanks so much Jonas for this Swedish delight. Opaque with a brown, thin foam head. Nose is very boozy, oil, molasses and soya sauce. Bitter chocolate malt flavour, green leaf, some good hoppiness in the mid-palate. Good stuff.

200ml, good measure, tap at The Rover. Devil-black body with a deep rusty shade. Brownish head, slowly fading, leaving nice lacework behind. Smell of smoked, salty sausages. Rich taste character of slightly smoked malts, liquorice and dark bitter malts offset by vanilla barrel. Well made and well balanced (Göteborg, 03.08.2010).
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2011 25cl, at 7%Vol, exclusive Swedish brew, thx to Pressklubben Stockholm!, complex Stout, yet easy to drink, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

25 cl. botella @ Akkurat, Stkhlm. Black colour, nice light brown medium creamy head. Roasty malty and caramel aroma with liqourice, coffee and light smoke. Good filling mouthfeel. Pleasant well roasted maltiness and caramel in the flavour, sweet with some coffee and chocolate, liqourice, some smoke and bit lactic.

250 ml bottle. Very flavorful and creamy stout. Dark syrup, coffee and dark chocolate, with a nice little portion of sweet citrusy notes to meat the roasted.bitterness. Big and full flavors for its ABV. 250 ml is a perfect serving size for this beer.
Den doftar mycket stärk espressokaffe och smakar förträfflig. Fina brända toner, oljig (det tycker vi om) och över huvud taget en ganska kraftig fin stout.

Dark brown.
Aroma with notes of vanilla, fruit and syrup. Fresh and lively.
Big flavour of marengue and fruit. Bitter.

Pouring thick to very dark beige-brown head, stable over crude oil-black beer. Lightly smoked, lightly salty nose on top of sweetness - or  umami  if you prefer - soy sauce, bit liquorice, and an intense perfume, as from musk, but totally masked by the head. Very dry, smokey, ashy taste with  bitter chocolate in the finish. Just a semblance of sweetness after some warming in the mouth - less perfumed than the nose, plain. Slick, thick, viscous; discreet warming. Not so very exciting in the end - but pretty expensive...
Pours a black beer, just a little very brown head. Smell is really smokey, hints of coffee and smoked meats. Taste is simmilar to the smell. Smokey, meaty with a hint of coffee but not too much.

Pours a lovely, thick, dark color, with some head depending on the vigor of the pour (naturally).  Rich chocolate flavors though not at the high end of the spectrum.  Roasted, chewy flavors, with a solid palate throughout.  Many thanks to Mirja and Christopher for a round of this beer, and it was a memorable night to share with such wonderful people.  Best wishes.  (bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm)

Tar colored. Thick beige head that quickly dissolves and leaves some residue on the glas. The flavor is rich, with dark chocolate and bitter hoppy tones. The finish is more emphasized than most stouts and leaves you refreshed and thisrsty for more. The worst thing about this beer is the pathetic 25 cl bottle. Come on....
Mustig öl där smakerna slår ut som en solfjäder i munnen. En enda stor kyss rakt upp i gommen. Möjligen lite defensiv för att vara en stout.

25cL bottle, courtesy of blomster. Thanks, Christer! Pours a deep, dark chocolate-brown color with cola edges; creamy, medium-tan head: mixed bubbles, solid retention and scattered, web-like lacing. Theres a persistent metallic note in the aroma, which is disappointing because of how solid everything is underneath: milk chocolate, roasted and burnt malts, along with some nicely presented peat: minimally astringent for how much roast and charred character is present here; the peatiness (if thats what Im getting here) is just lovely, everything well-integrated in the nose; that metallic note really exists on the edge of things, and fades quickly once your nose is in the glass; excellent aside from the off-note. Medium-full body; moderate, tight carbonation; creamy presence in the mouth, with just a touch of a wateriness on the edges (very strange for how much is packed in here, but there you go); high amounts of milk and dark chocolate notes, roasted malts, with hints of smoke and peat throughout; heavy amounts of charred, woody character, even though this isnt barrel-aged to my knowledge (and it doesnt taste like it is): the peat and bitter chocolate and charred malts just give a similar impression; a couple of very slight flaws (metal, water), this is ever so close to being an absolutely awesome beer; the peat, chocolate, and roasted malts are carefully presented alongside one another, and theres just enough sharpness and acidity to balance out the inherent creaminess. Solid stuff, with just very slight hints of a lactic character. Long, long finish of bitter chocolate, roasted and charred malts, and mineral bitterness; a nicely dry, well-roasted ending.

Bottle in Hotel room in Amsterdam ... to make room in luggage ...solid black ... bubbly tan head ... odd ovaltine ...roast malt ... bitter roast up front ... lots of caramel sugers ... Stella recons its gone off

Bottle. 

Basically black with a small beige head that leaves a fine ring of lacings. 

The aroma is malty with notes of dark sweet berries, roasted malts, chocolate, licorice and charred wood. 

The flavor is medium sweet and bitter with a decent roasted malty backbone with notes of chocolate, coffee and caramel. Not as much fruit aromas as in the nose. Hints of charred wood. The finish is dry and bitter with notes of minerals and licorice. 

Medium body and a bit too sharp carbonation.

A nice stout, comparably full flavor profile.

A black colored beer, with a thick foamy almost brown head. The aroma of dark fruits with roasted malts. Hints of coffee and chocolate. The taste is bitter of roasted malts. There is coffee. Its very dry. Notes of chocolate. In the back a little sweet. The aftertaste is very dry and bitter for a while.

Bottle, 2010-02-13, Göteborg
AR: pity/smokey, coffey, malt bread
AP: sout black body, brown  wee bubbly head
F: pity/smokey, coffey, malt bread, great bitterness, bourbon vanilla

Bottle. Pours black with a small but nice looking latte coloured head. The aroma is all about dark malts, coffee beans and such. Notes of mint (hops), chocolate and espresso coffee in taste. Aftertaste is bitter of dark coffee.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a black color with nice brown head, which leaves some lacing. Aroma is roasted and burnt with coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice, and charcoal. Flavour is really burnt and roasted with coffee, charcoal, liqurice and some hints of dark chocolate. Body is medium to full, carbonation is soft, the texture is rather creamy and smooth. Finish is bitter and rather dry. A tasty stout.

Brown medium sized creamy head, lacing.
Ar: Smoked meat, acidity, heavily roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, fruitiness, smoke.
F: Exactly the same flavour as in the nose, ending with a lingering bitterness. Lovely!
M: smooth yet refreshing, small bubbles.
T: Once again nynäshamn prove that they are masters of the porter/stout-segment!

A very dark pour resaults in a pitch black beer with a dense thick dark brown head that leaves some nice spots on the snifter used. Aroma is heavy and malty, charcoal, dark chocolate, caramell, coffe and some ashtray. Flavour is malty and round with lots caramell, heavy roasted malt, coal, light hops and minerals. Ends on a very dry and bitter note with lingering dark chocolate and light smoke. Mouthfeel is fairly full and creamy smooth. Very flavourfull for the (fairly) low abv.

Pours black with brown head. Excellent lacing. Herbal and hoppy on the nose along with roasted and smoked malts. Tastes burnt, lightly sweet and acidic. Alcohol. Feels syrupy. Medium to full bodied. I like it! 
(Served a bit on the chilly side from [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Små Rum, 12.1.2010) 
Tried it later in the evening at Rover. They served it more temperated and it drank a bit smoother. The smoke malts became more apparent.

Bottle. Pours deep brown coloured with a small light brown head. Aromas of caramel, leather, roasted malt, some smoky peat, chocolate and coffee. Flavours of coffee, licorice, tobacco and some caramel. Roasted, balanced, great..

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Chocolate, coffee, very malty and a hint of smoke. Pitch black colour, brown head, good lace. Light sweet, bitter, ashtray roasted. Medium body. Flavourful, well balanced.
Bottle, 7% ABV on the label. Black and opague. Creamy, milky aroma with ash and nesquick. Roasted ashy flavor with nesquick. Creamy mouthfeel, full bodied. I get lactose in the flavor.

Bottle that I picked up at Bierkoning, Amsterdam, consumed at home 01-11-09   Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma is bit liquoricey, roasty in fact really pleasant. Some burnt roastyness in mouth, little dry, nice balance, good bitterness, decent.   A7 A4 F7 P4 Ov14  3.6

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Appearance: 4/5
Pitch black liquid with a small dark brown foam that left some lacing.

Smell: 7/10
Not very intense. Musty, chocolate, sweet, nuts and a hint of coffee.

Taste: 7/10
Chocolate, nuts, dark bread, some roasted notes, hint of coffee. Low bitterness.

Mouthfeel: 4/5
Smooth and lean, dry and a light body.

Comment:
A stout with a weak smell and mild taste. Feels balanced but not very complex. Despite the small bottle and dark appearance it was quite easy to drink. Could probably work just as well in bigger bottles.

The most dominate flavour was chocolate. These kinds of beers usually have allot of roasted and coffee flavours but in this beer both where pretty mild. I think a bigger portion of those flavours would increase the overall flavour of the beer.

I tried it with some chocolate and it was a great match. Worked with both chocolate cake and truffles.

All in all a very drinkable beer but it feels like it lacks certain flavours and the body is a bit to light for my taste.  Re-rated in 2013.

On tap at gfw68, Stockholm.

Black with a beatiful large brownish head. 

A lot of coffee and chocolate in the aroma, also some smoke and caramel. Roasted tones, a bit oily feeling, balanced. Quite strong body. Liquid is quite dry, certainly a nice stout to drink.
Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark black body with dark brown head. Malty nose, some caramel. Full-bodied and somewhat smoky. Some chocolate in taste too. Pretty good.
Black with a lasting light brown head. Aroma of licorice, toffee and caramel with a burnt malt note. Sweet, roasted flavour with fruit, especially dates. Charcoal finish.

Bottle at the Bishops Arms, Malmo, 18th May 09. Lots of woodsmoke on the nose, malts too. Near black with a creamy tan head, which persists. Sweet and very, very drinkable. Sits well in the mouth with a lovely lingering soft smokiness.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2011 Rerate 2011: Draught @ Ölrepubliken Göteborg. Noire, moka.
Arôme malt, torréfie, légère note houblonnée avec une présence de malt plus allemande.
En bouche, malt allant vers le café, réglisse restant épaisse, palais est sec, fini garde note dune légère amertume houblonnée.



06 bottle @Tre Små Rum
pours black, off white head.
aroma and taste, malty, roasted, light chocolate and grainy with hints of fruits.
Dry mouthfeel, with a light bittersweet finish. Did not look like it aged too well.

Tap @ 3 Små Rum. Wonderful black appearance, with a creamy lasting light brown head. Strong roasted and burnt aroma, fresh roasted cocoa beans, bit of coffee, vanilla, ashes. Strong bodied, smooth, balanced, with clean and sharp flavours. Drank two pint in half an hour...;-)

Draft. Clear black with a smallish tanned head. Sadly it was served too cold. Still were nice with smokey, chocolate coffee taste and aroma, balanced. Will definitly order one when I see it the next time, best brew Ive had for a long time.

Draugh at Glenfiddich Warehouse, Stockholm.
Black with a brown head. 
Tastes of rosted barley, smoke, some chocolate and coffe.
It was a bit to carbonated (and cold) at first.
rbesg08 grand tasting, bottled. black with a modest beige head, hints of red berry and instant coffee in the aroma, plenty of roasted chocolatey flavours and a dry finish

Draught @ STBOWF. Stockholm Beer Festival 2008, Sweden.Clear dark black color with a large, frothy, excellent lacing, fully lasting, beige to light brown head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, roasted, coffee, burnt notes. smoke. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Nice balanced. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is smooth and soft. [260908]

Keg - - Pikkulintu, Helsinki
Almost black, small tan head. Spicy clove aroma, some salt. Very drying palate. Rich burnt taste. Quite simple, spoilt by the astringency. Saltiness was almost crotchy.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 (Re-rate, keg at Pikkulintu, 20131203) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and light brown. Aroma had smoke, roasted malts and creaminess. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, smoke, burnt malts, hops, lightly stale fruitiness and medium bitterness. Aftertaste had roasted malts, fruitiness and bitterness. A complex roasty brew. I liked.

Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2008-11-18. Black. Small tan coloured head. Roasty nose with some liquorice and metallic aromas. Full bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Roastedness, metalic flavours, hint of liquorice and bitterness in taste. Roasty and bitter aftertaste. Old rating: 8-3-8-3-14=3.7

[On tap at Bishops Arm, Vasagatan, Stockholm] Pours black with thick, creamy head. Smooth chocolate aroma with gentle vanilla notes. Smooth and rounded mouth-feel. Flavour is coffee, chocolate, liquorice and nougat, wonderful, and it all ends with a well-balanced roastiness.  Excelllent beer.

Bottle.  I think this came from per.  Pours brown with a well formed light brown head.  Smells of roasted malt, some apples, chocolate, spice.  Tastes of bitter malt, chocolate, some spicy hints.  I little too much bitterness, but nice.

Bottled(500ml). -Deep black coloured, medium sized brown head, plesant chocolate chicory nose. The taste is roasted malt, chocolate and dry chicory with notes of vanilla and smoke. Roasted finish and aftertaste. Very good stout.
Black with medium beige head. Roasted malt and chocolate in the nose. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, caramel and chocolate notes. Not bad.

(6/29/08) Bottle sample at RBESG08 grand tasting in Plzen. My notes say "Sotholmen Stout", but I’m quite sure it was this one. Black-colored but not opaque with a bit of brown foam. Aroma of roasted malt, some coffee and fruitiness. A rather dry flavor with some bitter chocolate, some coffee and hints of alcohol. Quite full-bodied.

RBESG08 grand tasting Poured a black body with a brown head. Grainy, chocolatey nose, notes of chicory, bit oily. Pleasant oily bitterish roasty taste, chicory, some meat, smoke and hop near the end. A nice stout.

RBESG2008: 50 cL bottle. Pours pitch black with a creamy light brown head. Smooth roasted malt aroma. Flavour is smooth roasted and light chocolate malt. Smooth chocolatly and roasted finish. Nice smooth roasted finish.

Dark pour, nearly black, with a dark tan, frothy head of foam.  Invigorating nose shows hints of dried chocolate, smoke, leather and dark fruit.  Incredibly flavorful for a 6.6% beer, lots of taste.  Hints of chocolate, smoke, tobacco and dried dark fruit.  The most impressive part is the finish, which lasts nearly 30 seconds.  An amazing recipe and also carefully brewed.
Black colour with a brown head. Roasted malty, light smokey aroma with fruity notes. Smokey flavor with a light coffee note and hints of sweet malts. Very dry finish with a tobacco note.
Bottle at Bishops Arms, Malmø - thanks Joergen. Black - brown head Smoke, burned, nice malty, light sweetness, licorice, coffee, light tobacco. Very nice.

(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of Storm. Pours black and opaque with a light brown head. Burned, coffeeish aroma with a whiff of tobacco. Medium body with sweetish and very burned malt accents and a smoky edge. Distinct malt bitterness in the finish. Plenty of smoke and tar in this one. 191207
Bottle. Black to dark brown colour with a little nice head. Aroma of roastedness and smoke. Flavour of malt, roastedness, coffee and dust. Very smooth tasty and ends up quite nice.

Bottled. Pitch black coloured. Brown dense head. Roast, smoke, chocolate and some coffee in the aroma. Flavour of tart, sweetness, roast, chocolate and smoke. Some sweetness notable. Is full bodied. Quite dry. Has a coffee bitter end full of roastyness. Nice.

Bottle. [Another great tasting session @ Papsoe] Average brown creamy head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Pitch black color. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, toasted malt, fruit. Over the palate roasted malt, coffee and hint of fruit, smoke. Medium to full bodied with a soft carbonation. Moderated sweet and bitter flavor. Lingering bitter coffee finish. 7 / 4 / 8 / 3 / 15

Draught at Delirium Cafe.
Black with a light brown head. Aroma moderate/heavy malty (roasted, burnt). Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body. really nice.
As I found no licorice and chocolate notes, I think it was served to cold.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2008 On-tap at The Rover, Gothenburg. Dark brown/black color with light brown head. Aroma of roasted/burned malt, coffee, smoke, dark berries, chocolate. The taste is also roasted/lightly burned with notes of smoke, dark fruit/berries, coffee, chocolate, and hop bitterness. Creamy, but also dry mouthfeel.

Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival 2007. Black with tan creamy head. Roasted and malty aroma with notes of popcorn. Strongly roasted and bittersweet flavor with bitter chocolade, some fruitiness, toffee and some grassy notes. Bitter finish with charcoal.

Draught. Low and quickly disappearing off-white head. If the last one I had was black this one is even blacker. Coffee choccolate aroma. Preaty heavily carbonated and hoppy flavor with coffee. Long lasting aftertaste.

Bottle. [thank you, omhper!] Pours pitch-black, deep brown head stays for quite some time in my tulip glass. Aroma is lots of coffee, dark chocolate and some ashes. Light mouthfeel. Flavour begins sweet, chocolatey, then turns very dry, ashy and well bitter. Very smooth.
Black. Brown head. Head is creamy and lasts. Aroma brings coffe, chocolat, tar and malt. Flavor is hops, tar,coffee, malt and chocolat. The palat is wonderful. Round and smooth.

Bottle at Haket-Göteborg, shared with a bunch of RBs. Pitch black with a huge, nougat and creamy head, that leaves a dark brown lace. The mouthfeel is oily and the aroma is full and has a lot of dark chocolate and coffee. The flavour has dark roasted coffee and malt, chocolate, an nice full body and ditto bitterness, and the finish is long and nicely roasted. 2373

Big dark brown fine-laced head. Opaque black body goes dark brown at edges. Deep milky burnt chocolate aroma with dry coffee notes. Sweetish light burnt sooty dry coffee taste with oily pine needle and cocoa notes. Slightly thin mouthfeel. No real aftertaste. Quite nice, but more body would improve it. (0.5l bottle at Tegners.)

Bottle (50 cl) at Haket, Göteborg, Sweden. Opaque black, creamy beige head. Intensely roasted malt aromas with notes of coffee and green pepper fruits, and some salty liquorice. Medium to heavy bodied, and smooth mouthfeel. Very dry and bitter, a bit harsh and unbalanced.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2008 Bottle at Haket,shared wit nice bounch of RBs.  Black colour,flat hbrown head.
Aroma of tar,coffee,dark Chocolateand salt lakris. Flavor is almost the same,some raisins is there too in the flavor, medium body, and a nice burned,alc finish. Nice!
New Rating, this one on Draft: Black colour, with a thin head. Aroma of flowers, citrus, dust,earthy, coffee,dark choclate. Flavor is almost the same here, but has a thin mouth feeling. 8/5/7/4-15=3,9

Pitch black pour producing a thick and dense light brown head. A rather sugary aroma offers brown sugar notes too match the latte coffee. It grows quite beany as it warms, but the anise component make that seem fitting. A fairly solid dark fruit basis also enters the portrait: raisins and plums mostly. The result feels fairly authentic, though th alcohol is nowhere to be found. Slightly powdery, medium palate. A rather aromatic stout that does not quite manages to translate all those subtleties on the palate.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2008 A Mes rate: Bottle at the Struise Farm during Urbains Post Zythos Struise Tasting.A very good looking beer, totally black and opaque. Nice chocolate malt aroma with some aniseed, a little metallic note and lots of liquorice and coffee. Similar flavour with a slight salty touch and some pleasant earth and smoke. Very dry finish. Bit of a sting on the palate, not quite enough body and too much carb. Not brimming with character but decent stuff and drinks strangely above its strength.

Draught @ Bishops Arms, Malmö. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Roasted malty aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee. Roasted malty flavor, some weak hints of smoke. Also hints of chocolate and coffee. Roasted finish with a long aftertaste with lots of chocolate.

(Draught at Monks Café, Stockholm, 24 Feb 2007) Opaque black colour with foamy, short, brown head. Very roasted nose with notes of tar, coffee and hints of smoke. Roasted taste with notes of heavily roasted black coffee (no sugar), smoke, tar, soy sauce, liquorice and a bitter finish with tobacco and French-roasted coffee. Full body, dry with a long, bitter, roasted finish that lasts forever. Awesome stuff!

Bottle at Haket Bar, Göteborg. Black with a huge, light brown head. Strong espresso aroma as well as that of dark fruit. Roasted coffee flavours combining with berries and leading on to a bitter chocolate finish. A nice stout.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2007 Beer number 100 - and fitting that its a great Swedish microbrew to mark the milestone with.
Draft @ the Glenfiddich Warehouse in Stockholm. Looked stunning in the glass, with the thickest puck of thick chocolately  head Ive ever seen. The aroma is a mixed of milk chocolate, coffee and a hint of smoke. These all carry over nicely to the taste, with a satisfying mouthfeel, which although a little light, is beautifully smooth. Quite sweet in the middle, and a medium bitter end. Loved it. Really loved it.

Draught.
Black coloured with a vreamy beige head.
Roasted aroma of coffee.
Roasted flavour of coffee and hops with notes of liquorice.
Dry roasted and hoppy finish.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2012 First ratingDraught at The Rover, Göteborg.Black look, brown head. Beautiful look. Intense scent of bread, mixed with grains, some chocolate and a bit lightly burnt toast. Mix of burnt malt, old coffee, small hints of red wine, also chocolate taste. Smooth but also thin mouthfeel. Medium high bitterness, though its rather husky and sharp. Long coffee aftertaste.5/5/5/3/11=2.9RerateDraught at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg.On October 19, 2008 - PorterfestivalenBlack color, brown head. Fresh, fruity, malty, sweet scent, also smoke and metallic. Banana mixed with sausage. Sweet, metallic, salty taste, also smoke. Dry roasted aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.6/4/7/4/14=3.5RerateAbout 3 years oldBottle thanks to Mats (not on Ratebeer)! RIP Mats.Sampled on December 17, 2010Clear dark reddish brown to black color, brown head. Sweet, licorice, cocoa scent. Chocolate, vinous, cocoa, coffee taste. Chocolate aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, dry medium bitterness. A bit oxidized wet paper scent too.Feels a bit too old.6/4/7/2/13=3.2RerateDraught at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg, during "Porterveckan 2012". I had a "galopp" size. On November 25, 2012.2009 version the pub stated.Black color, dark brown head. Sweet, spicy, light roasted scent. Roasted, malty, sweet taste. Roasted aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/7/3/14=3.5

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2007 (Draught and bottle) Pours dark to black with a brown head. Roasted and medium burned aroma with mostly coffee but also some dark creamy chocolate and hints of liquorice. Roasted, burned, a bit peppery flavour with some tar, asfalt, liquorice and coffee. Medium salty with a thouch of caviar. Medium to full body and bitterness. Lingering burned and smokey aftertaste.
Pours black with a thick beige head. Roasted, burnt, bready, tar, seasalt aroma. Woody, tobacco-ish, smoky flavour. Great bitterness. Coffee-ish finish.

Keg @ Stockholm Beer Festival 2005Starts to become a tradition at the Stockholm Beer Festival. Pitch black and big head. Nicely roasted, toasted aromas from malts. Lovely burned character balanced with a discrete dose of hops. I like.

Draught
Opaque black, coffee head. Roasted, chocolaty, cold coffee nose. "Menthol" in the  flavor, good roasted coffee flavor. Hoppyness in the aftertaste.
Draught. Black colour with brown head. Roasted malt along with vegetables and coffee in aroma. Coffee, caramel, and roasted malts in flavour. Full palate, but a bit sticky.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2008 (Draught@Pikkulintu) Smoky hints in the aroma. Not nearly as burned as in 2005, but milky sourness is present. Medium body, medium carbonation.
(Draught@Stockholm Beer Festival 2005, was 6-4-7-4-14) Almost opaque black with a small beige head. Bready, rye-malty aroma with a slight ashy sourness. Very burned-malty, slightly sweet-sour flavor. Medium-bodied, dryish-burned palate. A very decent stout.

Black color; the foam almost doesnt exist, oily appearance. Small roasted malt aroma, molasses. Some malt taste, the roasted malt adds a very light typical sourness; lots of caramel and light liquorice; good body strength. Very good beer.

almost black, the initial brown-tainted foam quickly disappears, strong coffeish aroma, roasted, medium-bodied, oily, robust bitterness, long dry coffeish/chocolatey aftertaste - a beautiful beer; thanks to Per for the bottle and fiulijn for sharing it !
Black.  The aroma is very much like a Tootsie Roll, but also with lots of dark chocolate and a whiff of smoke.  Sweet, very malty character.  Exceptionally chocolatey. Sweet, mouth-coating finish.

Black and thick with a light brown head.  Aroma was complex with notes of chocolate, coffee, molasses and some roasted nuts.  Also some smoke.  Sweet flavour and full of tastiness.  Some cocoa, anise and fruit.  Nice beer.

Hand-bottled (I think).  Oily black coloured beer with a very dark brown head.  Nose shows blackberry fruitiness, roasted malt, and a hint of smoke.  Fairly sweet, light carbonation but full-bodied.  Dark chocolate, roast, a touch of licorice and a long fruity and yeasty/dusty finish.  Probably the beer of the evening.

Sampled from draught at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2004 (#16).Beautiful pitch black beer with a foamy brown head. Mild roasted Irish Stout aroma with grassy and dusty tones. Creamy and chocolaty flavor with some fruit and hops. Sweet, full and tasty. Really nice!

The aroma is sweet, malty, and slightly smoked - the aroma is rather slight, but good. The color is pitch black and it has a good but disappearing head. The flavor is sweet chocolate with coffee and roasted notes. Great when it is served "warm".

Sampled at Stockholm Beer Festival 2003.
Black with a nice head.
A bit papery nose. Some licorice.
A burnt fruity flavour.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2007  Rerate. 1 year old keg at Haket. 
Maturation did its job very nice. Less burnt. Berries and juniper developed. Good roundiness. Nice.
 Sampled draught at Stockholm Beer Festival. 
Black with a dark brown head. Earthy, slight licoricy, milky aroma and flavour. Sweetish.

(sampled draught at Ardbeg Room, Stockholm, Sweden) Really black with a thick, big and long-lasting brown head. Roasty coffee in aroma with strong notes of licorice and salt. Big body with some huge roasty coffee notes. Long roasty finish with hints of licorice and salt and weak notes of butter. Complex.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2007 RERATE. Draught at Monks Café, Stockholm. Black with a huge brown head. Really roasted aroma, tar and some smoked fish. Roasted flavor, really bitter, notes of smoked fish, ashes, tar. Maybe a bit too roasted to let other flavors show. 

Old rating: (Stockholm Beer Festival 2003)
Definately black. Aroma is some licorice. Flavor is alittle sweet, but changes into a bitter finish.

Sampled draught at Stockholm Beer Festival.
Really black. Distinct creamy chocolate aroma with a touch of licorice. Sweet nose, big rounded maltiness. Roasty and fruity with salty bitterish finish. The most powerful so far of Nynäshamns many beers.
